definitions.definition: Any of many silicate minerals , such as feldspar and zeolite , in which a proportion of the Si ions are replaced by Al , the excess negative charge being balanced by extra sodium , potassium or calcium ions.

main_definition: ( inorganic chemistry ) Any of many silicate minerals , such as feldspar and zeolite , in which a proportion of the Si ions are replaced by Al , the excess negative charge being balanced by extra sodium , potassium or calcium ions.
